metadata.synopsis: Isobel is in her room re-casting the spell that is protecting the inn. After she spots you, she gives you information about Ketheric and a spell to protect you from the shadowcurse.After Isobel gives this information, she is interrupted by the Absolute-tadpoled Flaming Fist, who attempts to kidnap her.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Isobel came back to her room after the lake scene,and the player doesn't know about Ketheric wanting Isobel at Moonrise yet.

146.speaker: Narrator
146.text: *Your tingling Urge knows her face - this is the cleric Sceleritas sent you to kill.*

222.speaker: Player
222.text: He was trying to kidnap you. I sensed the tadpole in his head.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: He was trying to kidnap you. When he died, a tadpole came out of his head.

206.speaker: Isobel
206.text: A tadpole? Maiden's milk - how could that be?
206.context: NodeContext: Incredulous and angry at herself.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: I have no reason to lie. Marcus was a danger to you all.

3.speaker: Isobel
3.text: If that were true, why wait to make his move? He'd had every opportunity.

2.speaker: Isobel
2.text: What I see is an ally dead, and a stranger standing over his corpse.
2.context: NodeContext: Growing icy. About to attack.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: Believe it. He slipped through your fingers, but not mine.

164.speaker: Isobel
164.text: In that case, I owe you a debt of gratitude.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: He crowed about what fools you all were to trust him.

15.speaker: Isobel
15.text: If that's true, then he was right.

48.speaker: Isobel
48.text: You're the True Soul from the gate, right? It's a good thing you were here. I'm Isobel. And we have much to discuss.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I may be a True Soul, but I'm not like Marcus. The parasite doesn't control me.

108.speaker: Isobel
108.text: If I didn't believe it before, I certainly do now.
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nods in the direction of Marcus' corpse

225.speaker: Isobel
225.text: Speaking of blessings... you'll be needing my protection spell.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I've heard of you. You're protecting this inn - just not from Marcus.

113.speaker: Isobel
113.text: When you don't have eyes in the back of your head, it helps to have allies. Allies like you.

142.speaker: Isobel
142.text: Your trip to the Towers, for one. And what you plan to do there. A True Soul with a mind of their own...

106.speaker: Isobel
106.text: Well. I won't make that mistake twice.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I just did you a favour. Marcus was a traitor.

170.speaker: Isobel
170.text: Now that you mention it... he was here before Jaheira caught that tadpole she's been using.

135.speaker: Isobel
135.text: But... no. There was no opportunity - no chance for him to become infected.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I'm hungry for blood. And I want yours next.

190.speaker: Isobel
190.text: Nice of you to show your colours, True Soul. Jaheira will be so disappointed she trusted you.

155.speaker: Isobel
155.text: I don't mind, though. I've been itching to gut a traitor. Ketheric's out of reach, but here you are, right within striking distance.
155.context: NodeContext: With searing hatred, about ot attack player.

189.speaker: Isobel
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Preparing for battle with evil player.NodeContext: Right before battle.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: I will flay your skin and hang it over the balcony!

117.speaker: Player
117.text: I just did you a favour. Marcus wished to betray you. And there are other dark forces after you.

125.speaker: Isobel
125.text: Dark forces upon dark forces, so it seems.

20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel is standing on the balcony, bathed in a beam of moonlight piercing the darkness. Her hands are in a prayer position and she's chanting softly as the moonlight dances around her. She exhales, then inhales and breaths in tendrils of shadow, absorbing them. She swallows, then begins hacking coughing. The moonlight dissipates. She quickly goes from seeming like a divine spirit to a normal young woman.

53.speaker: Isobel
53.text: I didn't realise I had an audience.

84.speaker: Fist Marcus
84.context: NodeContext: With some warmth, as though they're good acquaintances if not friends

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *Isobel. The same name as Ketheric Thorm's daughter - the one whose sarcophagus you found empty in the family mausoleum.*

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I thought I smelled a Selûnite.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Let's not let an ancient squabble interfere with the task at hand.

279.speaker: Isobel
279.text: Not as ancient as you think.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: You can tell my allegiance from a look?

186.speaker: Isobel
186.text: It's an aura. Or a lack of one, really.

207.speaker: Isobel
207.text: Frankly, I'm surprised you're willing to help us. Your kind aren't known for their decency - particularly when a Sharran curse is our greatest obstacle.

283.speaker: Isobel
283.text: But if you are who I think you are, I'd be a fool to reject your help. The True Soul with... well, a soul. Imagine.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: I'm glad you've remembered who needs whose help here.

258.speaker: Isobel
258.text: Oh - aren't you looking for a protection spell?
258.context: NodeContext: Feigning ignorance. She knows the player needs her help, but the player has just finished trying to back her into a corner.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I am already protected. My Lady shields me from the curse.

10.speaker: Isobel
10.text: For now, perhaps. But Shar can be fickle, and her love can prove fleeting. Do not turn your back on an advantage you may need... even a Selûnite one.

274.speaker: Isobel
274.text: If nothing else, it can aid any companions who travel with you - somehow I doubt Shar's largesse was extended to them.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I need nothing from a Selûnite.

270.speaker: Isobel
270.text: But any others who travel with you may not agree. Do it for them at least - you will need all the help you can get out there.

144.speaker: Narrator
144.text: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

290.speaker: Player
290.text: Silently petition Lady Shar for guidance.

141.speaker: Narrator
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: It was nothing. Put it out of your mind.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *But was it truly nothing? The pain gripped you tight, robbing you of all composure for a moment...*
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

241.speaker: Narrator
241.text: *Pain bursts from the wound on your hand. You see yourself kneeling in a dark hall, surrounded by initiates. A female voice preaches against Selûne and all she stands for. You nod, rapt.*
241.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagery/memoriy fragment

109.speaker: Player
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

85.speaker: Isobel
85.text: Well! If the Moonmaiden didn't strike me dead for blessing you, she must rather approve of this little alliance.

95.speaker: Isobel
95.text: This will block the lesser effects of the shadow curse, allowing you to traverse the darkness outside... should Shar's own protection falter, that is.
95.context: NodeContext: Bit of faux concern at the end - taking a dig at a Sharran

73.speaker: Isobel
73.text: Curious. Surely the Nightsinger could have shielded all her followers, and made this place her domain long ago... yet she only acts now, and aids you alone. I wonder why.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: The Dark Lady's works aren't for me to question.

182.speaker: Isobel
182.text: Mustn't question the great shadow mother, must we?
182.context: NodeContext: bit of sarcasm in her voice, referring to Shar

256.speaker: Isobel
256.text: I'll stop needling you, though. You have more important things to do, after all.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: I've already been to Moonrise, but I have more work to do indeed.

288.speaker: Isobel
288.text: I imagine so, if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing off into the night.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: I do, though I already have a Moonlantern.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: That Moonlantern - you know it's powered by trapped pixies, right?

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Anything else I should know before heading off?

251.speaker: Player
251.text: I don't know what to make of it myself.

232.speaker: Isobel
232.text: I suppose Shar is nothing if not mysterious.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Nod. Better to humour her than make an enemy of all in this place. Lady Shar will understand.

90.speaker: Isobel
90.text: Refreshingly pragmatic of you. I sense Shar has offered some amount of protection to you already, but... well, no harm in extra precaution - even from a Selûnite.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: You seem to have a lot to say about my allegiance. Can we focus on the task at hand?

92.speaker: Isobel
92.text: I suppose that would be wise. We have a common enemy, after all: Ketheric Thorm.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I may have the parasite of a True Soul, but not the mind of one.

210.speaker: Isobel
210.text: And that's what makes you essential.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: I won't be spoken to like that by a Selûnite.

74.speaker: Isobel
74.text: We've both got a bitter pill to swallow. When this is all over, we can spit it back out.

278.speaker: Isobel
278.text: You'll be needing the protection spell, I presume?

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

60.speaker: Isobel
60.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village. I've heard you might be the person to stop him.

260.speaker: Isobel
260.text: A True Soul with a soul. Imagine.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: This Sharran exposed a traitor in your midst.

23.speaker: Isobel
23.text: Fair. I admit, Marcus waltzing around the place undetected bodes rather ill for our defences, doesn't it?

162.speaker: Isobel
162.text: Then again, the best defence is a good offence.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I want nothing more than to cut you up and eat you raw!

268.speaker: Isobel
268.text: The True Soul who's going to save us all. Pleased to meet you.
268.context: NodeContext: With a twinkle in her eye and a bit of swagger despite the fact htat she's just come off a coughing fit.

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: *The Urge deep within tingles. This is the one the Butler commanded you to kill.*

277.speaker: Narrator
277.text: *You choke down the obscene thoughts racking your body with a shiver.*

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

118.speaker: Isobel
118.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village. I've heard you might be the person to stop him.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Save you? How do you figure that?

263.speaker: Isobel
263.text: We've been waiting - hoping against hope - for someone like you.

229.speaker: Player
229.text: And you. I've heard you're the protector of this inn - the banisher of shadows.

47.speaker: Isobel
47.text: Myself and our Lady are doing what we can to hold the line. I hear you and your tadpole will be our offence.

173.speaker: Isobel
173.text: Free from the Absolute's influence, yet able to walk among cultists.
173.context: NodeContext: Lookihng at player intently, impressed, circumspect

26.speaker: Isobel
26.text: It's almost too good to be true. But I'd be a poor cleric indeed not to avail of a blessing when I see one.

59.speaker: Isobel
59.text: Let me guess: Jaheira's sent you to beg a protection spell off her favourite cleric.

18.context:
CinematicNodeContext: |Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene. (lighting tests in progree for clouds revealing the moon)

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *The blessing falls uneasily over your tainted body. You can't help but dream: to kill her would destroy all of Last Light. You yearn for it so deeply...*

245.speaker: Shadowheart
245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

120.speaker: Isobel
120.text: It'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.

68.speaker: Isobel
68.text: It won't be enough to protect you against areas of utter darkness, though - where the curse is strongest. This lantern should, though.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel hands the player the Moon Lantern.

111.speaker: Isobel
111.text: But there are places it won't help - places where the curse is darker. Stronger.

174.speaker: Isobel
174.text: The cultists are able to traverse even the deepest shadows, though. I don't know how - the Harpers are trying to figure it out.

177.speaker: Shadowheart
177.text: Selûnite magic. Dark Lady forgive me.
177.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has been revealed as a shar worshipperNodeContext: Low-key revulsion

252.speaker: Isobel
252.text: Good nose. Like a nasty little terrier.

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: A gaudy display. Let's just hope it actually protects us.
133.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has NOT been revealed as a shar worshipperNodeContext: Distaste (while keeping her cards to her chest re: her shar worship)

154.speaker: Isobel
154.text: Only a fool would doubt it.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Very nice of you, but I've been to Moonrise Towers already.

253.speaker: Isobel
253.text: You... have. Forgive me for gilding the lily. I suppose if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing into the night, there's work to be done there yet.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: I already have a Moonlantern. I can safely travel the shadows.

4.speaker: Isobel
4.text: Well! If I'd have realised, I'd have spared the theatrics. In that case, you should be able to navigate a path straight to your target. That's good - very good.

13.speaker: Isobel
13.text: I wish you luck. The very best of it.

45.speaker: Isobel
45.text: Well! Now you have two. Just in case.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: A Moonlantern? Those are powered by trapped pixies, you know.

114.speaker: Isobel
114.text: We'll be sure to free them - after Ketheric is dead.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Thank you - now I must take my leave.

98.speaker: Isobel
98.text: Good luck, and may the Moonmaiden protect you.
98.context: NodeContext: The 'if you can stand it' version is for a Sharran player

25.speaker: Isobel
25.text: While you're busy in the Towers, I'll be sure to - Marcus? What's wrong?
25.context: NodeContext: Sees Marcus approaching and startles somewhat.

167.speaker: Isobel
167.text: While you're busy in the Towers, I'll be sure to - wait. Do you hear that? Something's wrong...
167.context: NodeContext: Hears Marcus about to burst through the ceiling.

36.speaker: Isobel
36.text: While you're busy in the Towers, I'll keep the people here safe. If you find a way in, we'll come to your aid. Until then: go well. Be safe. And if you should meet Ketheric Thorm... be careful.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: The Moonmaiden's protection is most welcome - thank you for this boon.

115.speaker: Isobel
115.text: I'm sure your god already grants you a great deal - but a little extra never hurt.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Let us hope Selûne's protection is worth the sickly radiance.

158.speaker: Isobel
158.text: I don't think you can afford to be picky - no matter how distasteful your god finds mine.

223.speaker: Player
223.text: Selûne's divinity is... strange to me, but her aid is welcome.

96.speaker: Isobel
96.text: Well, we live in strange times.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: Anything else I should know before heading off?

264.speaker: Isobel
264.text: Ketheric is a frightening man. But you have something he doesn't: allies worth having.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: You must know this curse well to offer this blessing - can you tell me any more about its unnatural source?

33.speaker: Isobel
33.text: I... No. I cannot. I simply impart the blessings the Moonmaiden provides me.
33.context: NodeContext: stammer - slightly nervous, changing topic quickly

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Hold on - Marcus is a True Soul. He's here to kidnap you.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Wait - Marcus is a True Soul, you know. And not the good kind, like me.

22.speaker: Isobel
22.context: NodeContext: Eye roll/ sarcastic. Player just otld her Marcus is a True Soul and at first she doesn't believe them.

153.speaker: Isobel
153.context: NodeContext: Coming around to reality, suddenly very suspciious. Marcus is about ot pounce.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: I may have the parasite of a True Soul, but not the mind of one.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: I know your name, but little else. Care to enlighten me?

137.speaker: Isobel
137.text: I'm a cleric of Our Lady of Silver - the moon goddess Selûne.

28.speaker: Isobel
28.text: As long as I keep channelling her power, this inn stays un-cursed. A defence to your offence.
28.context: NodeContext: OFF-ence, not offence like offensive

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I already exposed the traitor among your ranks - what more do you want?

151.speaker: Isobel
151.text: And I'm very grateful. But very needy, too.

77.speaker: Isobel
77.text: Imagine our luck. We set up a desperate camp in the middle of a curse, in the heart of an evil cult - and who should emerge from the darkness but you.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I must say, it was incredible to see the Moonmaiden working through you.

78.speaker: Isobel
78.text: Needed here more than anywhere. This place is thick with Shar's curse. Can't be easy for our Lady to penetrate, but she finds a way.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: How have you made this sanctuary in the dark?

159.speaker: Isobel
159.text: Our Lady has granted me the ability to protect these people. It isn't a permanent fix, but it's what we've got.

101.speaker: Isobel
101.text: Speaking of - you must be here for the protection spell - yes?

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You must be a high cleric indeed to enjoy such direct blessings from our Lady.

40.speaker: Isobel
40.text: Not so much high as... necessary, perhaps.
40.context: NodeContext: A slight scoff of derision

244.speaker: Player
244.text: Are you faring all right? It can't be easy holding a lone candle in such darkness.

55.speaker: Isobel
55.text: All things with her strength. You know the litany.
55.context: NodeContext: A little sarcastically. She's got a bone to pick with Selune but isn't being too overt.

29.speaker: Isobel
29.text: All things in her strength. That's how the old litany goes, after all.
29.context: NodeContext: A little sarcastically. She's got a bone to pick with Selune but isn't being too overt.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: To see another so in touch with divinity is rare. You have my thanks, Selûnite.

289.speaker: Isobel
289.text: And you mine - not many comprehend the task of steadfast faith.

150.speaker: Isobel
150.text: Oh, joy. The True Soul turned out to be a baddie after all.
150.context: NodeContext: Feigned boredom, real anger. If the player tries to kidnap her.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: I want nothing more than to cut you up and eat you raw!

287.speaker: Isobel
287.text: The True Soul who's going to save us all. I'm Isobel. Pleased to meet you.
287.context: NodeContext: With a twinkle in her eye and a bit of swagger despite the fact htat she's just come off a coughing fit.

0.speaker: Isobel
0.text: And a Sharran one at that.

214.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel is already in her room.InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is already in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her into the room, etc.)

202.speaker: Isobel
202.text: The True Soul who's going to save us is a Sharran. Desperate times indeed.

240.speaker: Isobel
240.text: You're here for the protection spell, right? Come on - let's get you fit for purpose.

284.speaker: Isobel
284.text: You may be a Sharran, but you'll still be better off in those shadows with my Lady's blessing. Just sit still for a moment, please.

17.speaker: Isobel
17.text: We need to talk about Ketheric Thorm.

262.speaker: Isobel
262.text: I must stress how important it is that you defeat Ketheric Thorm.

265.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel returns to roomInternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is not in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her out of position, etc.)

238.speaker: Isobel
238.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel not yet kneeling at corpse.
